intro: Aethionema sabzevaricum, commonly known as the Persian rockcress, is a small, flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage is usually compact, with small, lobed leaves that help reduce water loss. The flowers, which are typically yellow or white, bloom in early spring and attract pollinators such as bees.
